column4: in the cli, how do I delete all files in a directory dated before 2010-08-01?
access time or modified time?
I'd guess modified time. Actually created time
hmm find doesnt have an option for creation time
I'd guess modified time, then. I can see it with ls -al
find . -mtime +19 -exec rm {} +
i think
thatd delete all files in the current directory and downward modified most recently more than 20 days ago
that just might save my apt-cacher. thank you too hiku
yep, and then your tabs get restored! yay!
is there a way I can load just one of the url I want at startup?
if you run:  firefox http://yahoo.com            <--- for example, thatd just open yahoo.com
I have firefox with an url loaded as a startup application. When I close firefox then reboot, fine. But when I just reboot without closing, it opens two tabs of the url
oh....umm lemme check firefox's command line options
dont know. i dont see a command line flag for that
me neither. maybe I have to play with profiles, or find a way to actually close firefox nicely on logout
maybe something in about:config to turn off tab restore?
edit -> preferences -> when firefox starts:   is it set to "show my home page" or "show my windows and tabs from last time"?
oh thats something you could do too
just home page
just set that url as your homepage and then dont set it to automatically open a url
I'll try that
